text: @AfricanGenesis Exactly.It does.We have gone through a lot of reforms at home.From access to credit to markets expansion.
@ siramer1 I do not want to comment on your question and leave the assessment of my government and the circumstances that have surrounded it for history. It is not the right time to say what I have.
@ samman1970 and rightly so!
Hello,I have been thinking to myself that I have broken a promise,which isn't my habit-I haven't been on twitter for a while...
..Yet some1 had asked me why and had replied that I would soon be back like the next day,it was not to be. I have taken wks if not months..
..Sori for that-muzangaya gutinda ntimuzangaya guhera-meaning u may blame me for delay but won't miss out completely
..That's the saying in my vernacular!
After that so many things have happened n I waited fr this guy to comment as he does on matters African but in vain...confirmed many things!
.there is a tweet b4 this one which didn't come thru-I asked if u rembr the debate and name-calling by a guy(jrnalist) from London...
I was amused by the fone-hacking saga that almost tore apart Britain! The politicians,the police,the jrnalists,the whistleblower(found dead)
Didn't know what to make of all this exactly! The media that normally helps us...was not being quite helpful n the'comms.expert' didn't help
Wasn't too much being made out of what is normal in that part of the world(only discretely)? Thot those were 'supposed' to happen only in..
..Africa! Rembr the stories of assasntn attempts by an African govt squads against little-if at all-known entities..??? Did any1 believe it?
May be it was serving another purpose all together! Some amb.who used to serve in the police and hated the Afr.country's govt,managed to ..
..Manipulate the FO n the police n media to try and destroy a good relationship of the 2 countries! Not to say that some pple in that part..
..Of the world consider Africa countries no countries at all! Its really up to us!
On a difrnt point but similar note,I have read about and listened directly to pple giving us lessons/instrctns on what to do/practice..that
@ samman1970 blind subsidies, relying on Gov 2 employ, spending 90% of budget on salaries is either a free market model nor is it sustainable
@ Deema22 peoples freedoms end when they infringe on the freedoms of others. We can not slander the innocent and say that is freedom of speech!
..,they don't practise themselves! Or insist that u do what u r already doing better than they ever ...
E.g women rights and empowerment,other than the support they give which is appreciated,why wud some of them bhave like they are introducing
..,to pple who don't kno anything or why not the same zeal in their countries where the gap is very evident for long time! Are they ..
@FaresAsadi Thank you. As long as one knows they are doing the RIGHT thing, with a clear conscious and with nothing 2 hide it becomes easier
..,prohibited may be..!?? Which makes them leSs democratic than we r made to believe!!??
Then the issue of legacy ..I follod some1 talking about pple in power and term limits(the famous debate)! There r countries btw in the West
That don't have term limits..to begin with,some leaders can run fr.top l/ship postns for as many time as their p/parties choose them or win
.,elections! These shd normally not be ones to give lectures on term limits! Having said this I also subscribe to term limits! Being in powr
,fr ever is not good,without even a break!? In Israel ldrs go and come back n they are democratic! What I don't like most is to make it appr
@patmaichbmf. You missed the point-bad things are bad it dsnt matter who s involved! There shdnt be justification! There s simply no side..
@patmaichbmf ..that shd have monopoly over what is right!
..Cont'd..what I don't like is to make it appear as if pple will only do the right thing when they have been told to do so by the kno-all...
@prospermselem. Nashkuru,hujaambo!?
@ebookafrica. Please yourself!

Speech by Ilham Aliyev at the opening ceremony of the International Holiday, dedicated to the twentieth anniversary of the state independence. http://t.co/HozBE4Zi
We celebrate this year's 20th anniversary of our independence. #Azerbaijan
We take this opportunity to look at the history of our developed state as the independent state, which has taken place over the past 20 years
We have strengthened our country's political system and developed our economy. #Azerbaijan
In the early years of our independence, complex processes were taking place in the country, and a civil war broke out. #Azerbaijan
In the history of our independence, 1993 is of exceptional importance. #Azerbaijan
@Yona_Mchomvu We always do that.I talked of regular policy reforms earlier as a way to figure out the best working alternatives.Thank you.!
In the complicated situation, our people have made a very wise and historic choice and chose Heydar Aliyev as President of the country. #Azerbaijan
@aikande @guardian Thank you.!I insist on both.Funds alone can't do.The same goes to the citizens and the government.We're all involved.
This political figure, who has great reputation and fame, laid the foundation for development in Azerbaijan, (cont) http://t.co/uFJ3M2LL
Since then, many work has been done in our country. Significant progress is observed in all areas. #Azerbaijan
#Health:TFDA's Drugs Quality Control Lab becomes the 1st National Regulatory Authority in Africa to be approved by WHO;http://t.co/BlU4dwM7
Our economy has grown by almost 300 percent. The share of the private sector in the country's economy has now reached 80 percent. #Azerbaijan
In our society there is a common position on national interests. #Azerbaijan
Today, about 50 percent of our population is Internet users. Today we have freedom of speech and press. #Azerbaijan
The Azerbaijani economy accounts for 75 percent of the South Caucasus economy. This figure will increase further. #Azerbaijan
According to the World Economic Forum, Azerbaijan is the 55th in the world in terms of competitiveness and the first in the CIS.
We are trying to convey the country's development criteria to European standards. #Azerbaijan
Today, Azerbaijan is not only a partner that can transport energy resources as a modern country (cont) http://t.co/b4EhLP7d
Reduction of poverty from 49 to 9% proves that income from oil and gas reserves of Azerbaijan is equally distributed
We are very pleased that we have transformed oil capital into human capital. We have left behind the "Dutch Syndrome". #Azerbaijan
Azerbaijan's role in connection with many European countries and the energy consumption of many European countries is growing. #Azerbaijan
Some countries now use 40 percent of Azerbaijani oil and gas. #Azerbaijan
We have shown ourselves as a strong partner. #Azerbaijan
20 years of independence. We are proud of our history, our culture. #Azerbaijan
The future of Azerbaijan is in the hands of the Azerbaijani people. This has not been the case for centuries. #Azerbaijan
Our greatest achievement is our independence, our freedom. #Azerbaijan
This is the greatest asset for the Azerbaijani people. For centuries the people of Azerbaijan have been deprived of their independence. #Azerbaijan

Today we have fired, with much pride and hope, the Chilean athletes who will compete in the Pan-American Games of Guadalajara.
We wish you much success: they will leave the name of Chile on high and will make a great leap forward for the national sport.
The 2014 South American Games will be held in Chile and will be our great opportunity to be a country of athletes.
Our athletes are the best ambassadors of @EligeVivirSano: healthy food, more sport and outdoor life as a family.
